Reviews.Title: “Problems Were 100% Taken Care Of!”
Reviews.Author: Auntie-Nanuuq
Reviews.Content: I normally stay @ the Hacienda B.W. in Old Town, but when I went online Yacht Harbor had a two night special. I booked online and I "Clicked" on the Special Rate link. Much to my surprise when I checked out, I was charged the full price. The next day I received an e-mail from the manager adjusting my charges, and a promise that she would look into why they confirmation stated "20% discount" but the discount not applied. I was also compensated for the fact that the refrigerator was not on and my food spoiled..... I normally do not like indoor hotels (doors that open to closed corridors), but this hotel wasn't too bad. The room was nice and clean, the bed & pillow were comfortable, the noise wasn't too bad considering it is on a main drag and next to the airport. My suggestion is that if you want to sit on the balcony (as I do) you ask for a front facing room, for that is where the view is. I like that I was not charged a per day parking fee or a fake "Resort Fee". I was charged a "Transient Tax" by the City (?)... but I know I'm not a "transient", I am a vacationer! The staff was friendly and accommodating. There is excellent transit service. The buses run past markets, shops, drug stores, and restaurants and then stop at the transit terminal at Old Town where you can spend the day or catch the trolley to downtown, seaport village, or the border. The hotel is 3 miles from Sea World, the Padres' Stadium, Point Loma and right next door to Shelter Island.

Reviews.Title: “Post cruise stopover”
Reviews.Author: lynneozzy
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay prior to cruise, great location with nice restaurants across the road and nice area to walk around Americas Cup Harbour. Scored a great room on top floor overlooking Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff, great place”
Reviews.Author: weggerzz
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Point Loma and we're going back again in the summer. We loved this place, very nice room with roomy bathroom, comfy beds, lot of space for hanging clothes and storing our suitcases. We faced the Holiday Inn but could also see the harbor, so nice. They had a nice lobby to sit in, free warm cookies every afternoon plus constant free coffee and tea in the lobby. Breakfast room was usually busy but for a reason, lots of free food like yogurt, cereal, toast, waffles, coffee, four different juices, fruit, hard boiled eggs, etc. Free shuttle from 8am to 8 pm and the day we left the van was down so they paid for a cab for us to the airport, nice. Lots of nice restaurants within walking distance, Pizza Nova, Jimmy's Famous, Point Break, Red Sails, Mitch's Seafood, etc and also within walking distance to Liberty Station with Trader Joe's, Panera Bread, Five Guys and beautiful grounds (it was the Naval Training Station before being renovated). Great staff especially Jason who always seemed to be there with a smile and friendly attitude. Other staff worked very hard to keep the place clean. The only complaint we have is that we could smell smoke when our patio door was open as they allow smoking on the sixth floor, we were on 3rd floor so it may have come from the parking lot below us. All in all, we loved it and have reservations to return in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bernie P
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is in urgent need of updating and looks like it hasn't had any improvements done for 20 years (except for a flat-screen TV in our room), it is clean and offers good value. Its position is good for access to the harbour area, airport and downtown. The complimentary breakfast is a great timesaver in the morning and free internet access is also a good feature ($6-8 per day at many other hotels). The staff are very helpful and friendly, which is worth one star alone. The main downside is road noise, as others have pointed out, plus a few noisy guests leaving for the airport at antisocial hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Borntotrav
Reviews.Content: Good location for airport and also harbour, free shuttle available 8am-8pm to airport and cruise terminal. Nice breakfast. Room facing Holiday Inn, not as sound proofed as some airport hotels, also traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed our Stay, Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: oldmanband
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for 3 nights in San Diego. Very close access to the downtown harbor (USS Midway aircraft carrier museum), Point Loma, Sunset Cliffs, Ocean Beach, Old Town, Balboa Park and the airport. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We had a corner room that was very quiet. They provide a decent breakfast, that included cook your own waffles, fruit, yogurt, cereal, breads, and of course coffee. Quite a bargan, Why pay more?

Reviews.Title: “No Free Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Beachbum2330
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 4th floor standard room with the view facing next door to the Holiday Inn. The continental breakfast was descent; cereal, bagels, toast, fruit, yogurt and waffles were among the options. We did plenty of research to know what we wanted with our stay. Reading the website for the hotel, and later finding it was advertised AT the hotel, we found there was supposed to be a free shuttle to and from the airport included. To our surprise we were unable to receive one from the airport because the hotel told us there wasn't a driver. It was 6:30pm. We decided at the end of our trip to request a shuttle to the airport a day in advance to make sure they would have a driver available. The woman at the desk took down when we would need it, our room # and our names. She, and the other 2 women standing at the desk, confirmed it and said that it was all set up. The next morning we checked out and decided to eat breakfast while waiting for the shuttle. 5 min after our shuttle was supposed to leave we asked if it was even coming, we were told to our surprise that there wasn't going to be a shuttle since they didn't have a driver. We were never told, or informed in anyway that we wouldn't have a ride. Unfortunately we left livid and were in turn late to the airport and extremely rushed. It was not a good end to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “clean, nice rooms, beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: aschurch
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12-11-11. We had two harbor facing rooms. Beautifull unobstructed view of the yacth harbor from our small balcony. Both were clean, nicely decorated rooms. We had a broken ice machine across hall from us, and we had to go to a different floor, very inconvienent. One room had a iron burn in carpet near bath. One room smelled of pot, and had a huge old style TV. The hot tub was non functional. Breakfast was really good, and had a wide selection to choose from. Underground parking was convienent and well lit. Some traffic and airpot noise. But convienently close (minutes) and has an airport shuttle. We stayed here the last night of our trip for that reason. Some rooms might not have as good a view of harbor, so ask if that is important to you. Nice area with harbor front business to walk to. You must have pizza across the street at Pizza Nova. Search my review... best pizza ever. Would stay at this hotel to be close to the pizza. :) Nice helpfull staff, and really no huge complaints from us. I think that it was a little pricey for the few minor things that were wrong, but was not a bad stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose, but never again (until they renovate)”
Reviews.Author: screenscraper
Reviews.Content: There are two hallways that meet in a â€˜Tâ€™ on each floor At the end of each hallway is a window consisting of glass slats. In our case on the sixth floor, the slats could not be closed properly, resulting in a chimney-like draft in the hallways. All rooms have a small balcony, and the seal on the door in our room was as as airtight as a burst balloon. While examining it, the upper third of the rubber seal fell down, the rest of it being very porous and just plain old (everything looked to be original from the day it was built). The amount of air passing through the door caused the curtains to move and would have sufficed to put out a candle. We had requested a non-smoking room, and when checking in I asked for a quiet room. This was on the sixth floor and I was puzzled that a non-smoking room would have an ash tray (another person in TripAdvisor commented this is the smoking floor, which then should not have been offered to us). We soon found out that smokers can use the balcony to smoke. The road in front of the hotel has expansion joints every twenty feet or so, and cars driving by give off a tuc-tuc-tuc sound all night (reminiscent of cobblestone roads in Germany). So we have a room that has a door that has effectively no seal, meaning we could hear each car going by all night long. The chimney effect in the hallways sucked air in through the balcony door, causing the heater to go on and off all night (we found no way of turning it off), plus the smoke from the room next door came in, turning our non-smoking room into a smoking room. We complained about the seal and maintenance was sent up. In keeping with everything else - they simply confirmed the door opened and closed properly. Nothing about the seal. We were offered a different room on the same floor, but standing in front of the balcony door we experienced the same draft as in our room, so we simply stayed put. I even considered buying some foam window seal at Wal-Mart to fix it, but decided the room wasnâ€™t worth the 5 bucks. As others have pointed out, breakfast is a disaster. Seating for 36 people. I counted 59 cars in the parking garage. You do the math, especially since many vehicles will have 2 or more passengers. Going into the breakfast room and hoping to find a seat requires a real optimist (or a fool). We drove around the corner to Dennys one day, and then grabbed some doughnuts at Winchellâ€™s (also just around the corner) the next day. The beds were OK and the room was clean, so no minus points there. The rooms have apparently been renovated in part (wallpaper, carpet), but the balcony doors look to be original equipment from when the hotel was built. The faucet handle on the vanity also looked to be original equipment (one of these handles you pull and pretty well limits you to all on or all off). The TV was an old Zenith picture-tube type. No telling how old it was. We checked out Saturday morning and Sunday morning we discovered my wife hat forgotten her keys. We called the hotel and somebody went up and retrieved the keys. Since we were planning to be in another BW hotel until Wednesday, I asked if they could be mailed using the post office guaranteed overnight service. I was given a number of reasons for not even trying something like that, rather than trying to find a constructive solution. Our confidence in the staff competence was somewhere down around the level of whale excrement in the ocean, and had no confidence whatsoever that the staff would be able to mail the keys to us anywhere, so we drove from Las Vegas to LAX via to San Diego to get the keys. Given that maybe only 2-3 people handled the key ring, it was pretty cheeky that one of them stole a small xenon flashlight from it. For a simple overnight, the hotel serves its purpose. We were not paying Hilton prices, so we did not expect Hilton service. On the other hand, I do expect a bit more than Motel 6. During our 10-day vacation we stayed in five BW hotels, and this was the absolute loser. We will never return - there are plenty of other hotels in the area for the same price that I would consider first.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible (non) sound proofed patio door!”
Reviews.Author: GabbaGabba
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here in January of 2012. We chose to stay here on the last night of our holiday so that we'd be close to the airport, car rental drop off and be able to use their laundry room facilities. Our check in went smoothly. We unloaded our suitcases and unfortunately on the way into the hotel from the parking area, there are about 8 stairs to climb before you enter the hotel lobby. Argh... We went to our room and got settled. It was clean, the bathroom was nice and bright and the sink area was separate and also well lit. The room was a fair size. Not big but not small either. The fridge and microwave were a good size and were spotless. One wall of our room was glass and had sliding doors out to the patio that looked out over some houses behind the hotel (run down dumps with garbage all over their property and one with a barking dog), it also looked out over the parking lot next door, Harbor Drive, the harbor and some restaurants across the street. Once we were settled in our room, I thought I'd get the laundry done and then we'd all head across the street to grab dinner before going to sleep. Problem 1:The laundry room was hard to find. It isn't shown on the hotel's map located in the "welcome binder" that you find in the room. All is said was that there was a laundry on the 2nd floor. I got off the elevator and sure enough I turned the wrong way. No biggie. When I finally did get to the room, I discovered, after putting coins in the washers, that the machine that sells soap was out. I went to the front desk and asked if they had some or if maintenance could refill the machine so I could get my laundry done. Nope. I was told that they had only one box (I needed two) and that the machines were not the hotel's. They belonged to some other company. The woman on the front desk then told me that I'd have to walk two blocks to buy laundry soap at a store if I wanted to do my laundry. Needless to say, I went back to my room, grabbed the car keys and headed off to find a grocery store. Not a very happy camper at this point. Once I got back and completed our laundry, I gave the jug of laundry soap to the woman at the front desk to offer to anyone else needing soap. She just looked at me and said "oh". It was at this point that my husband had a brain storm: why wouldn't the woman have offered you some of the hotel's soap? They have a laundry room where they wash the linens so they'd have soap to share since the laundry is supposed to be a hotel "amenity". Argh! Once the laundry was done, we got some food from a restaurant (Italian. Can't remember the name but it was awesome) and then settled in for sleep. Problem number 2: The restaurants across the street are handy so you don't have to drive to grab a meal but at night. Once you're parked you can just walk. But, here's the issue, there was all kinds of noise from patrons leaving them throughout the evening. I thought I had left the sliding glass doors open but had not. There was no sound proofing at all. It was terrible. We had an early morning flight and I was woken up at least once an hour, up until about 3 am. Not happy. Problem 3: The thermostat was out of order too. It was so hot in our room that the only way we could cool the room down was to turn on the air conditioner. We tried to turn off the unit but it wouldn't let us. Argh. Didn't stop for complimentary breakfast. It looked good but we wanted to get to the airport. I did use the computer to catch up on some emails. That was nice to have. Our check out was smooth. And our bill was what we were quoted. The location is great, the pool area looked nice (didn't use) If I didn't have to do laundry and the rooms were sound proofed from the outside noise (no inside hotel noise!), then we'd consider staying here again. But for what I needed, I was very disappointed in this hotel. Too bad it was our last experience in San Diego. All of our other hotels we perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, good service, louzy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mka_Finland
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here in Jan. -Location good if having a car -No problems with the noise of the airport as someone complained -Breakfast was louzy and breakfast room were extremely tiny -Service good -Big nice room

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: tallpalmtree
Reviews.Content: Very helpful, front desk associates and overall friendly staff. I was impressed by how decent and comfortable the rooms were. Especially the bed! A complimentary shuttle to and from the airport including local attractions is always a great service. Free self parking garage was a nice surprise along with the laundry facilities. This is my 1st stay in San Diego and I picked a good well kept hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good As Expected”
Reviews.Author: Deputydot
Reviews.Content: It was as good as we expected and we had no complaints. We arrived two days prior to our cruise to Hawaii. They had shuttle service directly to the ship which was very helpful and prompt. Our flight from the east coast was delayed so we arrived too late for the airport shuttle, but it was a short cab ride. We were able to walk to the nearby restaurants and catch the city bus to Balboa Park.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jarek_Yaroslav
Reviews.Content: the hotel was booked on deal, and exceeded the expectations. i think it did a major renovation recently, and significantly improved - when looking at ta reviews i noticed in got very bad reviews historically, but getting only positive recently. for our stay we found the room spacious, the beds comfortable, the breakfast basic but fully okeish. there is nice view from the window to harbor and yachts. also, the hotel has a pool (which we did not try). being middle of our trip in ca, i appreciated the hotel has a laundry machines, so that i can do my laundry myself for a price of having 1 pair of socks washed by room service elsewhere. we left hotel early to drive to nevada, but one of our friends stayed until afternoon in the hotel and then took afternoon flight back to sf, so the location was good for her to take free shuttle to the airport which took like 5 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: preacher31
Reviews.Content: This hotel didn't look like much from the outside and is not a luxury hotel, but was surprised at how clean and comfortable it was at the hotel. Everything worked and service was good. There was a little road noise, but not enough to bother my sleep. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: GRFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed there after Christmas for 5 days, 4 nights. Checked in at 1000pm and found our room ready, clean and located exactly where we requested. Room was clean, breakfast was good and the location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay.”
Reviews.Author: JonathanCh
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to stay in San Diego, the location is great. And the service is above average.

Reviews.Title: “Marathon Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheLiterati
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on my stay at this hotel, which was in close proximity to the expo / parking / shuttle to the start line for the San Diego Rock N Roll Marathon. Though just a bit outdated decor-wise, my room was spacious and clean. I loved that there was a small fridge in the room for me to keep my water, Gatorade and other hydration supplies and perishable snacks cold. I also appreciated the attentiveness of the front desk staff, and all in all found this hotel to be a very good value for my marathon weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Decent...”
Reviews.Author: Steversjunk
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our few nights at this hotel. The staff was friendly and efficient, and the hotel is conveniently located. Our 5th floor 'Harbor View' room was fine however the hotel would do well to install dual pane windows as fighter aircraft start your day off at 7am blasting down the North Island airbase's runway. Our excursions included 2 trips to the Point Loma Lighthouse (we were rained out on our 1st trip) which has fantastic views!, a Trolley tour ($34/person with no discounts) that started in Old Town and took us thru the downtown area and over to Coronado Island (It's not really an island, but the Coronado residents like to think so). You need to go early if you plan to get off the trolley to walk a bit. The last pick-ups are between 3pm to 4pm at most drop-off/pick-up stops. In someone else's review of the hotel, they mentioned that you might want to get to breakfast early to avoid the crowd... GREAT advice!!! The food was well stocked and the typical expanded continental style (Waffle makers, toast, sweet rolls & muffins, coffee, juice, oatmeal, etc.). All-in-all, reasonable rates, clean rooms, and a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Thomas A
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a good experience at this hotel. Especially considering the price for other hotels in San Diego. Here are the positives we found. We thought the location was great for our needs. We found the immediate area was quiet and easy to travel downtown, to the pacific ocean, etc. The front desk staff was very friendly and helped us several times. The covered parking feels secure and easy access to the hotel. The pool and hot tub were well maintained. On the negative side, the breakfast area was even more jam packed than several other hotels with free breakfast. After three nights we finally got the timing down and took the food to the pool area to eat. In regards to the room it was fairly clean. However we were placed in a handicap accessable room. I do not remember receiving this information when I made our reservation(?). I have stayed in these rooms before. But this one was much more bare bones in the bathroom than others I have experienced. Seems the floor was a bit worn. And all of our family thought the beds were too stiff for our taste. Our room was on the main floor and we had a view of the pool. We never heard any noise from the pool area. They also have cookies and coffee in the lobby in the late afternoon. Overall for central location with easy access and a good value in San Diego, you should look into this option. From looking at other hotels you can get closer to the bay or ocean, and maybe a more up to date room somewhere else. But you will likely pay $100 or more per night. For our trip this was a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: travelingalSeattleWA
Reviews.Content: Great value in San Diego. Rooms are not large, but they are very clean and the staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms have microwave, mini-fridge, hair dryer, coffee maker and ironing board - amenities that usually only come with a pricier hotel. You're not on the waterfront, but some rooms have a view if you're on a higher floor. The free (yes, it's included) breakfast has lots of choices and if you don't want a crowd you should get there early; waffles, yogurt, boiled eggs, cereals and pastries. Carry it back to your room if you want to get away from the crowd. Best part of the room: the sliding doors open and there is a little deck. I was there mid-week so wasn't bothered by noise, but it is in a busy street. Coffee in the lobby. Lots of restaurant choices just across the (very busy) street. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good Best Western to stay at...”
Reviews.Author: JulyLady76
Reviews.Content: Adrianna at the Front Desk was extremely helpful and kind when checking in. We needed to check in early and she was able to help us with that. The hotel is conveniently located to downtown SD, and continental breakfast was adequate. We did have to ask for additional towels, a new blanket and the towel bar fell off the wall during the night, but everyone was very accommodating and quick to respond. Free parking in a garage below the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Hagee
Reviews.Content: This was our last hotel during our trip with two families in USA -west. Stayed here three nights. Nice rooms with (alle of them I think) view on Marina. My wife and I had a room on the upper level and were disturbed by the Airconditioner on the roof (?). The rest of the party didn't seem to bother. I went to the reception late that night and got asigned an other room without hesitation. Perfect of course, and made possible because the place wasn't crowded. We slept perfectly in a new room. The hotel is very clean, staff is friendly, there is a refrigirator in the room. Complimentary breakfast is simple. All this for a very reasonable price. You can park your car for free in the parking lot under the hotel. It's only a short drive to downtown SD, Seaworld, the beaches. Across the street are a few good restaurants, chlidren-friendly. What mote can one want? I can recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service and location”
Reviews.Author: GeorgefromToronto
Reviews.Content: We were there just for four days before boarding our cruise so ,we didn't want to spend a lot of money. For only $75 p/night we got a nice room with a view to the marina. The location was perfect (ten minutes driving to downtown or the old town, twenty minutes to La Jolla, less than ten to the airport, ten to the cruise terminal, etc) People were very friendly, always smiling and helping you with everything you need and with the continental breakfast included (coffee, fruit juices, cereal, yogurt, toasts, bagles,etc) you don't need anything else. But if that is not enough, you have coffee for free the whole day in the reception area. If I have to be in San Diego again, I'll be here again. Even the parking is included!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kim L
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night here using a voucher from the local paper for a discounted stay. I thought our overall experience was OK. We stayed in room 301 and the traffic noise is incessant...I would really recommend that they change the door frame in the room to help insulate against the noise better. If you look, you can see gaps in the metal frame which basically just let the noise right in. We were there with our 10 month old daughter and thankfully she can sleep well enough, but I think it would have been a battle if we had to stay more than one night. The staff was very nice, great experience with them all around. The room cleanliness was ok. The room smelled musty and the carpeting was pulling away from the baseboards in some places. The website said that the rooms were recently rennovated I thought, but it seems as if this room maybe was not? The bathroom was clean and so were the linens, etc. The light in the vanity area took about 10 minutes to warm up and come on... For the discounted price we paid, the stay was probably worth it, but if I had to pay full price I think I would have requested a different room or made a comment to the staff about our experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Convenient Location, Would Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: daisygirl1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two children under 12 for 8 days at the end of August. The view of the marina and boats was terrific as we were on the 5th floor. We were happy with the room---it was a good size and comfortable for the four of us for 8 days. The beds were comfy and wireless internet was included which was great so that we could look up directions to all the places we visited. There is a microwave and small fridge that both came in handy many times. The breakfast was handy and a good deal as it saved us a lot of money on eating out. We often took apples or bananas with us to eat later in the day. The kids really enjoyed the pool out front and we used it every day along with the hot tub. One of the terrific things about this hotel is that parking is free---we checked out many hotels and quite a few charged for parking. You will definitely need a rental car if you want to get around to all of the terrific attractions in San Diego. We were extremely pleased with how convenient this hotel was to getting anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel is located close to a few restaurants that are right across the street and is very close to Rosecrans street which has restaurants, gas stations, liquor stores, grocery stores, banks, and is a main thoroughfare to all of the freeways. It takes about 8 minutes to drive downtown and is quite close to the airport too. All of the staff that we encountered at the hotel were friendly and helpful and we always felt welcome. We also met several other guests stayiing there who were friendly and seemed to also be quite happy with the hotel. We would recommend this hotel in a minute and have both said that we would come back if we were visiting San Diego again! It was convenient, had a great view, had a free, convienent breakfast, free parking and had everything that we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was ok”
Reviews.Author: BFLYNN013
Reviews.Content: We had a view of the bay because we were on top floor overlooking bay Hotel does not sit on the water it is accross the street from the Harbor The breakfast was good. I thought the bed was hard, fluffy pillows. We were caught in the 12 hr blackout, the staff was very helpful it was not a bad stay, but probably would stay on one of the islands

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel with great view!”
Reviews.Author: carter2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Best Western Hotel July 11- 18, 2011. This hotel was clean, modern and had s great view of San Diego Harbor. The location was quiet and the free breakfast was very good with waffles and hard boiled eggs, etc. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I would be glad to return to this hotel for future vacations!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Claudine R
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a little small and complimentary breakfast is limited and usually very crowded. But it's in a great location and great for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: jrussellmcjc
Reviews.Content: First of all I thouht we were "on" the harbor, the hotel is actually across the street from the harbor. The rooms were nice, staff was nice, breakfast was good but the room is too small. Overall nice .place just make sure you know you are not on the harnor!

Reviews.Title: “Great waterfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maria401
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Yacht Harbor Hotel. Our room overlooked a beautiful marina with several great restaurants within walking distance. There is a boardwalk across the street overlooking the marina. where each morning you can watch/take pictures of the boats bringing in the daily catch from the sportfishermen. This hotel is centrally located in the Point Loma area & within 5 minutes of the airport. A complete continental breakfast was included with enough variety to make everyone happy. The staff were friendly efficient & helpful. When we come back to 'Americas' City' we will certainly stay at the Yacht Harbor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back"”
Reviews.Author: calaz04
Reviews.Content: Did not like the underground parking - small area and hard to get to the lobby. Security latch broken - Single women with child - did not feel safe at all - Had to put chair and luggage infront of the door just to go to sleep. The surrounding neighborhood looked fine and not shady as the hotel circle area. Lot of street noise. Easy to See World. I don't like larger hotels - I would stay at Shelter Island next time. The staff was very helpful and kind. Bed hard - toilet kept stopping up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice economical hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kim6193
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a decent, economical, budget oriented hotel this is a good one. It's clean & the rooms are fine. You don't feel like your in a dumpy hotel. It has a free breakfast with pour your own waffles , cereal, danishes, fruit, muffins, yogurt etc. Yes, the hotel itself is a little aged but it's not dirty nor does it have bugs etc. I was with a group of 6 ladies who stayed here for Comic-Con & we would all stay here again. It was just abt a 10 - 15 min drive down Harbor Blvd to the Convention Ctr.

Reviews.Title: “Meh for the hotel...yay for the staff”
Reviews.Author: yanirules
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a family of four for SDCC. The hotel is basic, but it is clean and quiet. The room was very small (the kids even complained about that one) and the pool is oddly located basically right off the sidewalk like at a motel. The location, however, was perfect for our needs. There's a great italian restaurant/bar directly across the street. Also, within the hotel, the breakfast bar was pretty good...and you got to make your own fresh waffles from the griddle! As aforementioned, the staff was super nice and welcoming. Overall - nothing exciting, but I would definitely stay again if I needed to be in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Will Consider Other Options”
Reviews.Author: WishfulTraveler13
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at last minute on BW website. We were fortunate to get a reservation as this was during the Comic Con weekend. Our room was of adequate size and had the usual amenities of coffee maker; fridge; microwave. The beds were comfortable and the shower had good water pressure. The downside: the lighting in the room was pretty dark -- need individual reading lights next to bed and a brighter lamp at the desk. Also, upon entry our our room we found that our toilet had overflowed and the water was covering the bathroom floor and had also flowed out onto the carpet outside the bathroom. The front desk was very responsive and sent someone to deal w/ the situation quickly. The carpet the next day was still wet/squishy. The brkfst. room was pretty crowded -- a little hard to navigate to get to food items. Selection was fair for continental brkfst. Good Seattle's Best coffee in the lobby at all times. Gals at the front desk very friendly and helpful w/ directions to local attractions and restaurants. Overall our stay would be considered average as compared to similar hotel properties that we've stayed at in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Great view. Better than most BWs in the US.”
Reviews.Author: Marsh2
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms and both rooms were large and clean and had a great view of the harbor. The breakfast room got a little crowded during the morning rush but it was manageable. Not a bad place to stay. we will definitely come back to this hotel when we're in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for the price, clean, free parking, no major issues, but...”
Reviews.Author: aggiegirl05
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great. It was central to what we wanted to do. My husband and I stayed here on the last leg of our vacation for 3 days and 3 nights. The price was okay, free parking was a BIG plus for us. The rooms were definitely clean, but our room was VERY small. We had a king bed in a non-smoking room and we could barely walk around the room. This wasn't a big deal for us, though, as we were rarely in our room except for at night. I also requested a room on the side of the hotel due to previous travelers comments about the road noise from North Harbor Drive. This statement I found to be very true. I consider myself a pretty heavy sleeper and the noise even woke me up! It is rather shocking how loud that road is being that we weren't even facing the street. That said, the hotel is very small and it apears that almost every room is within earshot of North Harbor so I don't think that can be helped. I also found that the walls in this hotel were extremely thin because we heard our neighbor's alarm clock, as well as their crying baby almost every morning. We could also hear people's conversations in the hallway, no matter what time of day it was. Overall, it wasn't the worst hotel we've ever stayed in, but I still think I might stray a little further away from some of the major thoroughfares in San Diego. The hotel was definitely clean, and the customer service members were friendly and helpful. The 24-hr business center was nice because I did not bring my laptop along and we needed to check in for our flight the night before we left. The hotel was also in walking distance to some of the better harbor fish markets, which was a plus because parking can be difficult at times. I liked this hotel and our issues may not be as bothersome to some people, and we also understand that some things like road noise can't be helped.

Reviews.Title: “Even Nicer Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: hopeh1122
Reviews.Content: Let me say this first - I am not a picky, high maintenance, ritzy type person. I am also not a lazy, dirty slob. I am above average in neatness, an admitted exercise & health nut and feel I have reasonable expectations. Hopefully that helps you understand where I am coming from as you read this review. First of all - the customer service and friendliness of staff at this hotel is outstanding. Adriana, at the front desk was pleasant, helpful and happy to see us. She got us two rooms together even though it wasn't easy and she did it quickly. The rooms are small (a king bed dominates the room) but the clean and comfortable. The room has a desk, chair, fridge, microwave, tv - the usual things you'd expect. The bed had LOTS of pillows and the mattress was the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. The room looked out over a parking lot (as most do - your other view option is the street near the harbor) but I could care less. I had no intention of sitting on my deck in SAN DIEGO anyway - who stays in their room in SD!? The shower actually has heavy flow (unlike most hotels where you have to dance around in the shower to get wet) and a tub deep enough to soak in if you want to. My only drawback to the room would be somewhat small, no view, and need another outlet near the computer desk, but those are minor things. The pool is small but clean and a spa is available too. The workout room has a treadmill, bike, eliptical machine, towels, and inflated rubber ball and a weight machine. A bit warm in there, so if you like to sweat, you'll love it. And get there early - your card opens the door anytime and hotel staff do not enforce the hours. Breakfast is GREAT. Waffles, pastries, toast, fruit, yogurt, peanut butter, jam, hard boiled eggs, coffee, juices, tea...etc. You gotta love American style continental! Everything tastes good, but it gets crowded so go before 8 if you can. There are apples and sometimes even home baked chocolate chip cookies in the lobby during the day. Yes, there is traffic noise in the rooms since you are on a main street. If you need a "sound soother" (a small machine that emits "white noise") at night just ask. I called from my room for one and had it in less than 15 minutes. They're free and work great to drown out the traffic noise for those of you who find that a drawback to being at a centrally located hotel. Parking is free and this hotel is near EVERYTHING - literally less than 15 minutes away are the following - downtown SD, Old Town SD, the Zoo, Point Loma, all the military bases, the Midway Battleship, etc. Airport is 5 minutes away and there is a free shuttle. Carlsbad is 30 minutes away and Mission Bay is 20 minutes away and both are worth the drive. I had only one issue at the hotel - my shower knob fell off for some reason and it was replaced and fixed in less than 10 minutes. The maintenance guy apologized and was very pleasant. So, to sum it up - super friendly staff & great customer service, free parking, good breakfast, centrally located, clean & comfy. What more do you want from a Best Western?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel very clean”
Reviews.Author: TrvllvrNYC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine and clean. Free breakfast is plentiful. is at the end of the main drag in San Diego. 2 minutes to airport but distant from highways. If yo can get an unobstructed view you can see the harbor. Two restaurants across the street that are a little pricey but a mile away is Rosecrans st. which has a;; the fast food joints. Nothing wrong with this hotel but you can get cheaper nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Will return, would recommend this hotel to friends and family!”
Reviews.Author: myfamilyfun
Reviews.Content: We almost didn't stay here because of a few reviews that we read where people complained about the rooms being too small, too noisy from the airport, and bad service. I am a picky person and want things just right when I stay somewhere. Every staff member I met had a smile was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and standard size.The first day we noticed each time a jet flew over, which is often, but after that we didn't notice them. The breakfast they offered is far better and had more to choose from than a dried up bagel or muffin that you get at some of the really expensive hotels! They offered cereal, bagels, eggs, fresh fruit, and waffles, all included in the price of the room. So yes we were very pleased with this hotel and will stay here again, we had 2 rooms and spent 2 wks. here. I recommend this hotel to everyone! Plenty of parking, covered and open! Thank you for making our stay comfortable and pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - good location - good value”
Reviews.Author: CruisenFamily
Reviews.Content: We had a Harbor side room - room was big enough for the roll away we needed (also had 2 queen beds). It was a little noisy from the traffic out front - I read about this and was worried. Didn't keep us up but we noticed it. Breakfast was just okay but included which is nice. They had fresh baked cookies in the afternoon - you could smell them the minute you walked in the hotel YUM! Also, free coffee/tea/hot chocolate set up in the lobby. Free parking was great! Good location. We walked across the street for dinner every night. Some nice restaurants on the harbor. Hotel had free access to a computer so I could print my boarding passes - liked that! Close to the airport; Petco Park, and the Gas Lamp quarter but didn't have to pay the prices of the Gas Lamp Quarter. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MMO_Istanbul
Reviews.Content: hotel has a good location for those who want to enjoy the city and the surrounding by car. the rooms need renovation however they were very clean and the blankets/sheets were changed every day. rooms with the beatiful harbor view are a bit noisy due to passing cars on the concrete road however it did not cause me and my wife (who is very sensitive to noise) to have any sleepless nights. all hotel employees we dealt with ie, receptionists, housekeepers, breakfast room maids, were very helpful and friendly. we were very happy with our one week stay at this hotel for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Dental Work in Tijuana”
Reviews.Author: pataylor9954
Reviews.Content: The front desk service was exemplary. They knew about the buses & the trolleys which is key to getting around in San Diego. Because of their transit system we didn't have to rent a car. The room was delightful. We had a double queen facing the pool on the 2nd floor across from the elevator. The elevator does make a bit of noise every time it goes up and down. So you might want to choose one away from it. We had room 211. The location of the hotel is across the street from the harbor which is delightful. The amenities are OK. Great pizza & other food items across the street. Actually it was the ABSOLUTELY BEST PIZZA I have every had! Another cozy harbor restaurant farther south which had decent food for a reasonable price and then another strictly fish restaurant even farther south on the harbor which had some fantastic fish dishes. More expensive though. There are another couple of restaurants nearby as well. There is a convenience store within 2 blocks, bus within 2 blocks and fast food within 2 blocks. Liquor store too! Area is safe and generally quiet except for the main streets which are busy. Breakfast is served from 6-9 or 10? It includes toast, bagels, pastries, fruit, yoghurt, waffles, boiled eggs, coffe, tea, juice, milk, cereals. I liked the architecture of the hotel best plus it was spotless. The least thing I liked was the elevator noise. It doesn't keep you awake at night, but if you are in the room it is always present. It is really too far from Tijuana if you have to go many times, as we did for dental work. It takes about 1.5 - 2 hours each way which is just too long for us. Didn't swim in the pool, but the hot tub was really appreciated as San Diego was not that warm. All in all we had a very pleasant stay and all the staff we had any dealings with were competant, courteous, and helpful. I'd definitely stay again if I had business in that area. For reference it takes about 15 minutes to get to the Old Town trolley station on the bus. If you miss the bus it's another 15 - 30 minutes depending on time of day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy access, all good!”
Reviews.Author: StuartinFiji
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the BEST WESTERN Yacht Harbor Hotel in San Diego, and we have absolutely no complaints, in fact this is our hotel of choice on our California roadshows. Free WiFi is a must for us on the road, and this hotel abounds with access points. If you stay in a room facing Holiday Inn you also get a strong WiFi signal from there, and can use that too. Rooms are standard Best Western, comfortable clean, and well maintained; not the musty smell found in other older BW's we've stayed in. Self service laundry on 2nd floor is appreciated, clean, fast and well kept. A boon for those of us on the road for 14 days. Breakfast is good and well stocked, always enough of the healthy choices as well as the ever popular waffles!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pawsmom
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't stay here because I had read reviews that it was noisy being so close to the airport. I am a light sleeper but I had no problem at all during our 3 night stay. I did wake up once to a beeping truck backing up but fell back to sleep quickly- my husband didn't hear it. The price was good, the location was good, and it was easy to find after getting lost in the city because all you had to do was follow the signs to the airport since it was nearby. There are restuarants across the street to eat at, the parking was free (huge plus there!), and it was close to all the major attractions (although it was rainy and cold when we went so we couldn't really enjoy them). There were cookies and coffee, tea, and hot cocoa available in the lobby in the afternoon and breakfast wasn't too bad although the breakfast room was pretty small and crowded and it would help if they invested in a new toaster. I have no major complaints though. Our King room was small but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It's a very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: splice35mm
Reviews.Content: It's interesting to finally visit a hotel property after you've spent time researching and reading all the reviews. Yacht Harbor receives mostly favorable reviews, but there seemed to be a fair number of unhappy people as well. Upon arrival, my wife and I were surprised that anyone would have a problem here. We thought it was great, especially considering the reasonable room rate. Of all the complaints we read, there was only one that we agreed was justified. Some of the rooms are pretty small, and with two queen beds there isn't much in the way of spaciousness. We knew this going in, and sure enough, we found ourselves in one of the smaller rooms. Normally, this would be no problem (we're not playing frisbee inside much anymore), but on this trip we had our bicycles with us and wanted to keep them safe inside our room. Two bikes would have been a little tough. I picked up the phone and asked the front desk if they had a larger room available. The answer was a simple YES. I immediately went down and exchanged our keys, and we moved to a larger room even though it had the same two queen beds. Painless. We would have survived comfortably in the smaller room, but this was definitely better. It didn't cost us anything to get the larger room. In addition, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was very good. Fitness center was completely functional and adequate for a decent workout. The pool and jacuzzi were very nice. The entire place is spotless. The location is great. Yes, there's a lot of traffic on Harbor Blvd, but it never bothered us. Yes, the breakfast room is a bit small, but it's really no problem. I forget what the other complaints were, but we have to say that we really enjoyed our stay. We definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: tinask
Reviews.Content: We just completed a week long stay at this hotel with two small children, and I am very sorry that we did. I certainly wonâ€™t repeat the same mistake again. I have never written a review for a hotel before but felt so strongly about my family's horrible experience with this one, that i want to share my experience in hopes of helping others avoid this hotel. This is an Extremely Dated hotel. We checked in and booked the more expensive room, yet received the tiniest room with 2 queen size beds Iâ€™ve ever been in. We had a trouble finding room for our 2 suitcases. When I went to the front desk to inquire about the larger rooms, the staff flatly said because I have booked it on Bookit.com there is nothing they can do. The hotel balconies are tiny and have no furniture, therefore they are pretty much useless. The sliding door on our balcony didnâ€™t shut properly. The hotel is old and extremely outdated and looks so much worse than it does in the online pictures. The breakfast was pretty much a fend for yourself type of brawl, i'm not sure how the hotel expects its guests to fit into that tiny room, maneuver theirselves around the hordes of people and then actually find a place to sit at one of their five tables. Between the street noise, and the noise from the rooms, it was difficult to sleep without the earplugs. The beds are cheap and uncomfortable. The toilet kept flushing and we had to call the service twice. We had to get our room key rekeyed 5 times during our 7 day stay. I wish we would have packed the first night and left. I have stayed in many hotels and I must say this was the worst experience I ever had. I was extremely dissapointed with the Best Western Chain. This is an overpriced hotel doesnâ€™t deserve more than 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “The start of a Great Vacation :)”
Reviews.Author: OHTom&Cheryl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 2 nights prior to boarding a cruise ship to the Mexican Riviera. We quickly and easily found a shuttle bus that took us from the airport to the hotel, free of charge. Check in was effecient and the room was clean and comfortable, however the king sized bed made it seem a little small. The breakfast provided was more than enough to start the day and there were several restaurants within a short walk for lunch and supper. Also, within a short distance was a bus stop that took us downtown for more sightseeing. The lobby had a comfortable area to just sit and talk while enjoying hot chocolate or coffee. Seems there were a lot of people staying here prior to cruising and the hotel provided free shuttle service to the ship's terminal. Fortunately, this was handled effeciently by assigning departure times for everyone, which worked out very well. Definitely, a great start to a wonderful vacation

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: satisfied187069
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the quality of the room,services and staff provided by the hotel during our recent stay.On arrival,we drove straight into the covered parking area and gained access directly into the hotel thro the rear door which leads directly from the lobby.In addition,parking was FREE in comparison to other hotels where charges are made. The room was very pleasant,bright and airy with wonderful views of the harbour.The FREE breakfast was very adequate and also free hot drinks were avialable in the lobby. All in all,I would highly recommend this hotel for good quqlity and exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Mildew-ridden reeking room; overcharged”
Reviews.Author: AllysSouthernOregon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a year ago and it was fine. This year it was awful. We had reserved one of the larger rooms, as we learned on our earlier trip some are tiny and cramped while others are much more spacious. We were not given the room we had reserved but were instead given the tiny one. Additionally the room we had reeked of mildew and the carpet under the sink was soaking. No other room was available our first night and it was too late to find other accommodations. We stayed for two miserable nights and then moved elsewhere. Staff refused to adjust the rate for either our reservation OR for mildew problem which was extreme. Additionally, sliding door to balcony did not shut properly and wind howled in. I spoke with the manager once during our stay and he said he would "look into" this. He was not available on checkout and did not respond to my request to contact me. Great location for our travels to San Diego that we will not avail ourselves of again. There are a lot of accommodations in the area.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy”
Reviews.Author: halgal
Reviews.Content: Room was large enough but linen & towels were seedy. Single pane windows & very noisy, couldnt get a good nights sleep. We were in room 511. Location to airport 5mins so that was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean hotel...just a bit noisy on the bay side.”
Reviews.Author: coffinjordan
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. It was priced right, easy to get to as well as easy to get to other San Diego destinations. The free and abundance of parking was a huge bonus. The hotel is a bit dated, but the room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The only drawback to our room (416) was that is sounded like the window/sliding door was open because you could here the road outside so clearly. Made it kind of difficult to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, FREE parking, GREAT views”
Reviews.Author: TashiSutton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent choice. Its minutes from the airport and a few more minutes to downtown and the beach. The traffic around the hotel is manageable. The staff is helpful and attentive to your needs. Very important point there is covered parking and the parking is FREE. The rooms are nicely appointed and very clean with good views. I have stayed here 6 times in the last 18 months and have recommended this hotel to many of my friends. No one has been disappointed. ENJOY!!! Sierra Vista, AZ

Reviews.Title: “Good location by downtown/airport.”
Reviews.Author: momwnb
Reviews.Content: Our stay was Christmas Eve. The desk clerk was very pleasant and called the pizza place across the street to check on their hours. Our room was not excessively large but we liked the separate bathroom/vanity area. Beds were comfortable and everything was clean. The lighted light switches were very helpful at night. We had to shut the door really hard to get it to close which made quite a bit of noice. We did not find the traffic noise very bad but it was the 24th and our room was on the side of the building. We did not have any airport noise either. Breakfast was typical and there were not a lot of tables but with reduced occupancy everyone seemed to fit if people didn't linger too long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CycloneIowa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a few days for our vacation. We asked for the harbor view,which was a great view. We were able to sit and watch the ships coming and going. The room was clean and comfortable. The only bad part was the noise from the road at night. There would be cars making noise until late and then early in the AM. Earplugs would be recommended if you are a light sleeper. The breakfast in the morning was pretty good. It was too cold to use the pool,but it was a decent size. Lots of restaurants and it had quick access to the main routes to see everything. The business center had a decent computer and printer which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: needtogoonvacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights with a young child and found this hotel to be exactly what we needed: a room with comfortable beds to sleep in and a place to relax from days out exploring all at a reasonable price. The staff was very helpful, offering great restaurant suggestions and moving us to a new room without hesitation when we found a problem with the ac in our room. The breakfast room, while small, was constantly being stocked with food to keep up with the guests (we found that by going to breakfast before 8 am, we missed the crowd and had the room to ourselves). We were so tired from our activities during that day, that we never noticed the street noise commented on by other guests. We couldn't have asked for a better stay and will definitely be staying here on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel,terrible sleep quality!”
Reviews.Author: luckyamerica36
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked 4 nights at this hotel but unfortunatley only managed 1.This had nothing to do with the hotel itself,the place was great.Check in was easy,rooms large and very very clean,great location,everything one could wish for,but we just couldn't put up with the noise from the road outside.I think a lot of it is to do with the road surface itself,you get a strange rat a tat from the tyres of the cars.The traffic went on until quite late and then got busy again around 5.30am.Such a shame as it really is a lovely hotel but sleep quality is important when you are out and about all day sightseeing.I would recommend this hotel to a heavy sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bevzvet
Reviews.Content: We arrived 9/18/10 for a three night stay, to a friendly & helpful staff. I had lots a questions and all were answered with a smile. Our room was on the 4th floor with a view of the harbor from our small balcony. The beds were extremely comfortable, clean and double sheeted. The older TV has lots of channels and the air conditioning was quiet. The entire room was spotless. The free buffet breakfast included coffee, tea, 4 different juices, milk, toast, hard boiled eggs, cereal, make your own waffles, dainish, apples, bananas and yogurt. 6 tables each with 4 chairs were available. Trays were set out if you wanted to bring food back to your room. The pool was clean but seldom used because it was cool during our visit. There is a computer and printer to use at no cost. Free parking is available in the garage. The only thing I would have like would be chairs on the balcony to sit and enjoy the views. Many restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: travelfan0558
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Yacht Harbor Best Western was so refreshing. Just across the street from Point Loma Harbor. The atmosphere and location were great. There are plenty of area restaurants, traffic is minimal nearby, walking along the marina and harbor is so pleasant. There are just too many good things to say about staying there. The staff is very friendly and helpful and they always have a smile for you. The hotel is well managed and very clean. Breakfast is filling, the homemade waffles are wonderful and the coffee, available 24/7 is soooo good!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paddickp
Reviews.Content: A great hotel very clean no noise the only faults we could find was no safe in room and no chairs on the balcony. Oh the free internet was very poor

Reviews.Title: “this hotel has apparently never heard of the term "customer service"”
Reviews.Author: bri918
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review for a hotel before but felt so strongly about my family's horrible experience with this one i that i want to share my experience in hopes of helping others avoid this hotel. Let me start by saying we booked this hotel after reading the reviews and they were so-so, but we figured why not, we basically just needed a place to sleep, and let the kids unwind at night.......sooooo wrong. The first night we called the front desk for an extra blanket and we did get one-after three phone calls and an hour and a half later. And the breakfast was pretty much a fend for yourself type of brawl, i'm not sure how the hotel expects its guests to fit into that tiny room, maneuver theirselves around the hordes of people and then actually find a place to sit at one of their five tables. After the second morning we gave up and took the food up to the room, which by the way was rather small itself; and don't even get me started on the lack of counter space in the bathroom, which if you are a girl you will understand this. The traffic noise at night was unbearable, and no, there was not even a fan in the bathroom to help drown out the sound. On the third night there was a knock on our door at 1:00 AM. yes, 1:00 AM and it was someone from the front desk who didnt speak english, he just said,"keys for room #605" my husband replied, "this is room # 401". but the guy just repeated it, and handed my husband the keys. So we called the front desk and the clerk just said,"oh, i guess he had the wrong room." uhhhh...... ya think???? it was one in the morning and the guy had the wrong room and woke up our entire family and thats all you can say???? Also, every hour the air conditioner made a HUGE banging noise that kept us awake, it was pretty much a long miserable night. The next day we complained to the manager, she said because we had booked our room on expedia, there was NOTHING she could about it, but perhaps we could talk to Keith. But at that point we just wanted to GET OUT OF THERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel all in all”
Reviews.Author: WhereWeGoinNext
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the BW Yacht Harbor and were very pleased. You can't beat the location-about 5 minutes from the airport, 5 minutes from Ocean Beach and Sunset Cliffs and 2 minutes from the Harbor. No airplane noise, which was great! Plenty of conveniences nearby just a few streets over: Post office, grocery, starbucks, fast food of all sorts, shops, gas stations, great restaurants and cheap eats too! The beds felt brand new as did the bedding. Clean bathroom and carpeting, comfortable chairs and spacious. We liked that the toilet and shower were closed from the vanity area so we could both get ready and not have to stand in a sauna if one was showering. We'd stayed at the Sheraton on Harbor Island once before and the rooms were extremely small so this was nice to have room to move about in. We used the chairs as our suitcase stands and never bumped into anything. The room had a large closet nook with a good iron and ironing board as well as a very good sized fridge (even had a freezer drawer) and microwave. We visited the heated (but not too hot) pool which was nice with a good number of chaises and chairs, as well as umbrella tables for 4. The parking was also very convenient and the best part--free! There is a parking garage that hoops around the back of the hotel that you can get in/out of from either driveway. There is a small front driveway for check-in marked Fire Lane, but we saw people dropping off/picking up so it's ok to park there for a few minutes. The front was the only ramp accessible entrance to the lobby we saw. Though not an issue for us, but could be for some--from the parking garage there is about a 10 step staircase to get to the lobby. We paid about $10 extra per night to have the Harbor view and it was beautiful. There is one little problem with being on the harbor side--the street noise from Harbor Drive. I think because of the curvature of the building, the noise is captured from the street, so if you have a harbor view, you may awake to sounds of cars. It's not that there's a lot of traffic--the Point Loma area is great because it's not really traffick-y but even one car going about 45 is oddly loud. Could be the material used for the road, but just a warning. The negatives for our stay were minor. The towels were in good shape but weren't really thick like some other hotels, the vanity lighting was not as bright as I'd like but there was also lighting near the full length mirror as well. We would have liked suitcase stands (I'm not one for unpacking into the drawers) and an in-room safe, but we had no trouble with the staff, so I guess we didn't need it--we're just used to having them. The hotel breakfast room seemed about the size of a hotel room so it was Definitely not large enough for more than about 12 guests to sit. We had cereal and juice once, but decided to walk one block up on Harbor Drive to eat at Winchell's donuts most mornings (fabulous donuts by the way!). We would highly recommend and think this hotel should be a 3 star. It's as nice as any Hampton Inn, Country Inn & Suites, or Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: jondska
Reviews.Content: My nephew's wedding was in San Diego so he blocked out rooms for us at a really good rate. I was a bit leery reading some of the reviews but wasn't planning on spending a lot of time in the room so we booked it. The staff was great. We had a problem with the lock on our door and they immediately replaced it. Room was clean and nice to have fridge and microwave. Would have been nice to have a couple of little chairs on the balcony but we stood out there a few times and enjoyed the view. Traffic noise was a bit loud but never bothered us with the patio door closed. Nice breakfast selection that the staff kept well stocked from 6:30-9:30. The only complaint I have is for some of the guests who were greedy pigs, stuffing their bags with 4 or 5 bananas and taking ridiculous amounts of food to their rooms. There's always going to be some of those wherever you go. Very convenient location next to the marina where I enjoyed an early morning stroll and watched the fishermen coming in with their catch. Some nice restaurants nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “Stepped Up When it Mattered”
Reviews.Author: millcreekkim
Reviews.Content: I was a little wary of the reviews about this property but the location and price swayed me to take a chance. I am glad I did. We arrived late in the evening and the desk staff wasn't all that enthusiastic but they weren't rude either. We had a similar issue with the rate but it got resolved without a problem. We had picked a room on the lower end of the price spectrum and the room we got was very small. It was nicely appointed and clean but had a very strange odor, the lock on the hall way and the balcony door didn't work right and A/C fan was out of balance and rattled something firece, so we went back to the front desk to report the broken lock and other issues and the girl behind the counter, while not exactly apologetic, said she'd get us another room. She didn't mention the new room was an upgrade both in size and view so we were quite surprised to see we had lucked out. After that our 3 day stay was uneventful. This hotel is in a pretty quiet area, maybe some traffic noise but not horrible. All in all we had a great stay and would definitely there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: janesw
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. Clean and comfortable, great lobby area with free tea and coffee. Bedroom spacious, 2 queens, we travelled with children 9 and 15. Pool good size at front of hotel with plenty of sunshine and jacuzzi. Right opposite the marina with some great boats floating about! Excellent for walking and watching fishing trips. Saw seal in marina waters! Only complaint is that the breakfast room is very small and can't accommodate the number of guests wanting breakfast so some took their food back to their rooms and some ate in the pleasant lobby. Need to drive to get to restaurants in old town etc but would definitely recommend. Not noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay again for the $$”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTCPD
Reviews.Content: Is this the best hotel in SD? No, of course not. Does it give you everything you need on a budget and then some? Yes. It is what the BW is known for. The rooms were a little on the small side but considering the age of the hotel, they were good. The noise level in the morning from traffic was high but the hotel can't control that. Breakfast was OK. Small room but fair Continental breakfast. Pool was outside in the front of the hotel. Hottub was OK. It is centrally located to everything in SD. If you need groceries, go to Vons on Rosecrans. Bella checked us in and she was GREAT! Kudos to her. We asked for an upper floor room and she accommodated us with no issue. She smiled and was very pleasant. Made the checkin process awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it's meant to....”
Reviews.Author: PhilipW4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel over the Memorial Day weekend so it was very busy. The rooms were fine, the views weren't great and it was quite noisy but the location was handy (quite central and close to the airport also). Breakfast was busy but the food was plentiful. Even though the hotel is on a VERY busy road the pool area was nice and there are some good hotels around. As mentioned, the main bonus for me was the access to San Diego airport. The hotel also has a shuttle to the airport although when they dropped me off they left me at the wrong terminal even though I'd questioned them on whether it was the right one (which they assured me it was). San Diego airport is so small that it wasn't an issue but was a little frustrating!

Reviews.Title: “Negative Nancy's are Wrong!”
Reviews.Author: MrFX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent five nights at this Hotel after reading all of the previous negative reviews, we decided that they were probably whiners and complainers. We were right. We chose this hotel for several reasons, close to airport, centrally located to downtown and the beaches, Ocean, Mission and Pacific. We also chose this hotel because we are Best Western points collectors and don't like to spend tons of $$ on rooms that you mostly just sleep and shower in. We were not disappointed on any of our requirements. The hotel (not apartment) has been obviously recently updated, clean, fresh, new furniture. We had a harbor view room, great view but in our late forties we had no problem standing (due to lack of furniture) to enjoy the view. The road noise is mostly in the peak rush hour times but did no bother us. At check in we were given a rate that was different than we booked, easily rectified with my confirmation print out, at no time did I feel that I was being ripped off, I put it down to initially booking with the National call center and then adding a night and taking part in a more recent 20% off promo for Best Western Rewards members by calling the hotel directly. The front desk staff was always friendly, courteous and helpful. The hotel was very clean, our room as well, nice King with fridge and microwave, no water problems. The cleaning staff did use an air freshener in the rooms and hallways that I requested to not be used in our room and they honored this request with out a problem. The breakfast provided was up to Best Western standards, pastries, waffle makers, apples, oranges, toast, cereals, breakfast burritos, three kinds of juice, tea and coffee (Starbucks). We found it very easy to get to downtown and the beaches from here, get a proper street map the tourist ones are not detailed enough. We used the computer in the lobby for local information and to check email from our kids, possibly a sign limiting use would be helpful, some people don't seem to like to share. We used the hot tub, very clean and well maintained. We don't understand what some people expect for reasonably priced hotels, if they want a resort go to one and pay for it. We would recommend this hotel and will stay there again when we return to San Diego in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, provided you are a good sleeper”
Reviews.Author: peterad99
Reviews.Content: I was here as part of a group. Had disturbed nights as traffic noise was intrusive (I was on fifth floor). ALSO the ice machine on my floor was so noisy that the vibrations produced a buzz in the room that I (and others ) found intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Must be an old apartment”
Reviews.Author: louiesowner
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review off by saying I am a travel agent, and so I got a really good rate at this hotel. I like to check out hotels for my clients and I figured this one might be good because they shuttle to and from the airport and the cruise ship terminal in San Diego. After staying here for 2 nights, I don't think I would recommend it. First off... when we drove up to the hotel, there is no front drop off parking. It looks like there is an area for it, but there is a sign that says No parking / Fire lane. So we had to drive around to the side of the building and bring our luggage to the lobby. As you drive up you kinda look at the place and wonder why it looks like an apartment. We were apprehensive right from the start. Second... when we checked in the guys didn't seem very organized and couldn't handle more than 1 person checking in. Someone butt in front of me and nobody said anything. Then when we got our room, we took our luggage and wandered to our room. As we were walking there I mentioned to my husband about being on the first floor and that it would seem they are putting us in the bad room because we got such a good rate... boy was I right. Our room was just barely bigger than a Manhatten hotel room. We couldn't even fit the luggage cart into the room. They also gave us a room facing the construction. We figured that is where we had to stay because we got a good rate. Once I turned on my laptop and found out the internet wasn't working there, we went back to the desk and told them to get that fixed. At this point a lady was at the desk and she seemed much more effecient. She found us another room, that was way bigger and the internet worked. So we took it. Third issue... I think truly this is an old apartment because the sound travels everywhere. The patio door to the outside seems to be very thing and you can whisper outside at the street and you can hear it in the room. It was horrible. I don't think the door closed properly, but even so, the sound was horrible. We got woken up one morning at 1am and had to phone down to customer service to inform them that a bunch of guys where in the pool smoking pot and partying. Since the pool is just around the corner from the lobby, I don't understand why they didn't hear it. The ladies who were at the front desk where great and always helpful. The cleaning staff was good and the continental breakfast was better than I had expected (considering the hotel). I don't even think for the price (travel agent rate), I would stay there again. It was way to noisy and the fact that they gave us that horrible room in the first place, was a bad first impression. I won't be recommending it to my clients. If you are forewarned about this place, then it is ok. Everything was clean and it was so nice and close to everything. Maybe if they did some updates to the rooms and made it look a little more like a hotel and not an apartment, it would be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: runbkswm
Reviews.Content: I don't get some of the other reviews on this site. I was in town on a business trip and this place was perfect for me. I had a large room overlooking the harbor. Bed was super comfy and linens were new & clean. The staff told me that the hotel had been refurbished recently and it was clear that it had been. The free wi-fi was great for checking my email. Breakfast was nothing fancy except for the waffles (yum!!) and free too. I had dinner across the road at the Pizza joint and that was very tasty and convenient. There was some road noise but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: mestiza50
Reviews.Content: The price and location was our reason for choosing this hotel. What a disappointment. The hotel is old and not well maintained. The carpet in the room was old and had an awful smell. It was difficult to open and close the entry door,. The vanity was small and cramped. The beds took up most of the space. We planned to stay 3 days but checked out after 1 day.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: kashish_shrm
Reviews.Content: nice location, excellent service...

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LeahMcT
Reviews.Content: My large extended family, including my husband, 2 year old, 1 year old, my 50-something parents, my 60-something mother-in-law and my 70-something grandmother all came to San Diego for a little family holiday. We booked this hotel based on the price (as my retired grandmother and mother-in-law are on tight budgets) and it's proximity to all the attractions we wanted to see. I was amazed at just how close it was to the airport without feeling like we were on the runway as well as just how close it was to all amenities (10 minutes to Sea World, 5 minutes to the Zoo, many restaurants and a grocery store within minutes). The rooms are basic but clean, the bathrooms look like they've recently been renovated, and quite sound-proof (my parents were in the room beside us and couldn't hear the kids at all). The rooms do seem like they are a touch on the small side, we felt a little cramped with 3 suitcases in there but not to the point of being annoying. There was a mini-fridge and a microwave in the room which was fantastic for us with small children. My only minor complaints was that the "continental breakfast" was quite minimal and by our 5th day the breads/muffins/etc were stale and there was only a couple of bruised apples and under ripe oranges for fruit. The other was when we checked in there was a discrepency over the price - I had booked via the 1-800 number and was quoted an AAA rate of $89/night. However when I checked in they told me I was wrong and the rate they had was $99/night. Fortunately for me I had my printed e-mail confirmation and once I showed this to the front desk agent she immediately corrected it, but I wonder what would have happened had I not had that. Overall I would definately stay at this hotel again as would the rest of my extended family. You definately cannot beat the price and the great location to everything.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: LaurenWestHills
Reviews.Content: What a great place. I have been to San Diego before but I have never stayed at this hotel. I was so pleasantly surprised! The location is perfect. The views of the Harbor are beautiful. I was in town for business but I would love to bring my family next time. The rooms were big and the people at the hotel were extra helpful. I thank them for making my time away from home comfortable!!

Reviews.Title: “Has It All..Views, Value, Comfort & Service!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling2NJ
Reviews.Content: First time in San Diego, stayed 4 nights before a cruise. Called several hotels, and after hearing that this one was just renovated (brand-new mattresses!) decided to give it a try. We couldn't have been happier with our decision. Our king room had a great view of the harbor, and was spotless, with new carpets & window treatments (the furniture seemed a little dated, and probably should be updated to match the rest of the hotel).
