The bed was super comfortable, and the room amenities (microwave, coffee, fridge, ironing board & iron) made our stay very comfortable. The pool and hot tub where a great place to relax after a day of sightseeing, and they have an exercise room also, if you are so inclined (not while on vacation, please). The location was excellent. We walked 2 blocks to a bus stop, for a direct bus to Old Town, then took off from there on our adventures. Also, can walk along the water to a great park. The front desk was very helpful with all our questions, and the internet access came in handy. Overall, I think this is a great hotel for the price, with friendly, efficient staff & a can't-beat location. Can't wait to come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Updated Hotel, Spacious Room, Incredible View..... Pretty Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Frangutzo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels at five times the price but truly found this hotel to offer an exceptional value. We expected a small room and just ok views, but the room was spacious, (seemed larger than normal rooms) and the view was INCREDIBLE. The business center, high speed broadband service, workout room, breakfast every morning, microwave, refrigerator, and coffee maker made it easy to stay there the week. The hotel was recently updated and the balconies with the harbor view of the yachts coming and going was just awesome. We had a great time and enjoyed the stay. Staff was courteous and seemed "on it".

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: travelfan0558
Reviews.Content: The room was clean & spacious with a balcony view of the harbor. It was beautiful day & night. The staff was exceedingly polite & gracious to all. We enjoyed the stay & cannot wait to return. The location was close to all the sites we were there for: harbor, Sea World, the boardwalk, shopping with easy access, good food within walking distance, close to the airport, without the noise!! Yes, its a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MarshallGulch
Reviews.Content: We chose this Best Western because of the proximity to events. But I would not go back. First it is VERY dated. The walls and Windows do not keep out the sounds. Very small room. Had to move a chair to get in and out of the door. The bed was comfortable, that was a saving grace. To get your luggage to your room is a ordeal. One cart, no elevator from parking. The staff was very nice, decent cont. breakfast and the downstairs coffee was ok. If you plan to go deep sea fishing at from the landing. This is good. But next time, I would go Next door to the Holiday Inn Bayside. I went next door to check it out. They have a small store downstairs for water, beer, alcohol and small gifts.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: terracore
Reviews.Content: Due to flight schedules, we overnighted at this hotel. It was clean, a good price, and close to the airport. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I didnâ€™t use the pool area or similar amenities but they looked very clean. The hotel had a few restaurants and stores within convenient walking distance. The neighborhood felt safe at night. I do have 2 complaints. #1 is that the hotel shuttle stops running at 8:00pm. The short taxi ride was $10.00, so if you weighing trip price into your hotel equation take this into consideration. If I had known this I could have gotten a slightly better hotel room closer to the airport with a free shuttle for the same overall price. Complaint #2: My room with 2 double beds sleeps four adults. The in-room coffee maker makes only one cup (not small carafeâ€¦ one cup) of coffee and only came with enough coffee for one small single cup. You do the math. Fortunately we left late enough to catch the free breakfast that also has coffee. The free breakfast items were barely edibleâ€¦ but free. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MoosemamaSFBayArea
Reviews.Content: Not the worst place in town but certainly not the best! Maybe they will work out the kinks once they finish remodeling, but it was an irritating place to stay after a long flight. Despite having their van parked prominently out in front, they had to call taxi's for us, as apparently they didn't have anyone to drive the vehicle! They DID reimburse us, but we were still out the tip to the taxi driver. We booked two queen beds and got ONE king size. When we called down, it took a while for them to come with a new key. A maintenance guy brought it, and didn't ask for our old keys until I volunteered...It is scary to stay in a place that doesn't have good security on keys. My brother got a smoking room despite asking for non-smoking. The air conditioner unit in the ceiling dripped water on us every time we walked by--and since it was in the hallway, we got wet a lot. It had a coffeemaker, but not a coffee POT. When I called the front desk, they weren't sure they had another! But they found one--forty minutes later. I tried to call my brother before we got there--no one answered the phone--EVER! I called repeatedly too. On the plus side--it was clean and in a good location. The pool was nice and the staff were pleasant. There are other "bargains" nearby and next time I'd try those first.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: daylilly50
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel if you are going to or from the airport or piers. While the room was on the small size it was recently redone, and very attractive, fresh and clean. It had everything you would want, including a microwave, refrigerator, two cordless phones. The shower was great. A plus was the computer room and gym. We had dinner across the street on the harbor at an excellent italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “stayed there practically to use their internet and find another place”
Reviews.Author: fraidelwachy
Reviews.Content: i booked a five night stay at the hotel, and walked in, and went to the rooms. The room was dark, musty, smelly, and extremely small and squishy. we sat on the bed and it was hard like marble. lets just say we're grateful for them having wireless, because i went onto priceline and booked a beautiful hotel for cheaper than this hotel, and it was a 4 star nice big roomy, nicely decorated room with friendly staff and excellent room service.

Reviews.Title: “Haven't seen any new reviews of this place”
Reviews.Author: StuartDisco
Reviews.Content: We hadn't seen any recent reviews since April, so we thought we'd take a chance and hopefully the place has improved. Well, I don't know if it has, but there are some positives that should be mentioned. We had 3 rooms in our party. Luckily, we were only staying for 1 night. We came in on a train from LA and we needed to stay a night before our cruise the next morning. I called the hotel just as our train got to the San Diego station. The lady on the phone was very friendly and she said they'd send a van over right away. By the time we got off the train and walked over to the taxi area with our bags, they were already there waiting for us. The hotel is about 4 miles from the Amtrak station, so it was very handy that they have a shuttle van. We got to the hotel and checked in without problems. The lobby is now renovated and looks very nice. Same with the elevators. Our rooms, however... The first room was kind of smelly and the tub faucet was running. I couldn't get it to stop. So I called down and they gave me a new room. This room was fine. It wasn't renovated that I could tell, but a bacis room with 2 queen beds. But hey, what do you expect from a Best Western. Our 2nd party had the same problem and they also got a new room. But around 10pm, their AC unit started dripping into the room and again had to change rooms. Our 3rd party had a decent enough room. So that's the only bad parts. But again, the front desk was friendly and resolved the issues. In the morning, we had their free breakfast. Nothing exciting. Cereal, breads, danishes, coffee, juice, some microwave egg sandwiches. Can't complain. Again they were friendly upon checkout and our 2nd room folks got a bit of a discount for having to change rooms so late in the evening. During check-in, we had reserved a time slot for our ride over to the cruise terminal and they were ready to take us when we went down to the lobby. Again, this was a nice service and saved us from paying for a taxi. In case it helps anyone, the cruise terminal is back in downtown about 3 blocks from the Amtrak station. So the morning after our cruise, we just hiked over to the Amtrak and caught our train back to LA. And also, if you need something to eat while at the hotel, there were several restaurants within walking distance. Also, just 2 blocks away was a bus stop. And that bus takes you straight into Old Town, or you can transfer there to just about anywhere in the city.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Yacht Harbor Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5005 N Harbor Dr, San Diego, CA 92106
